summary: I resigned because of their discrimination.
textFirstPerson: I refer to my recent resignation due to [insert protected characteristic] discrimination.
textThirdPerson: I have been instructed by the above named client, who resigned because they were discriminated against.

summary: I resigned because of mistreatment due to whistleblowing and discrimination.
textFirstPerson: I refer to my recent resignation, which was due to discrimination and mistreatment because of my whistleblowing. This amounts to automatically unfair and discriminatory constructive dismissal.
textThirdPerson: I have been instructed by the above named client, who resigned due to discrimination and maltreatment due to whistleblowing.

summary: I'm writing in respect of unlawful treatment I suffered at work.
textFirstPerson: I write in relation to unlawful treatment I have suffered at work.
textThirdPerson: I have been instructed by the above named client, who has been treated unlawfully at work.

summary: I refer to my resignation due to health and safety concerns.
textFirstPerson: I refer to my recent resignation that was due to health and safety concerns.

summary: I'm writing in relation to an unlawful deduction from my wages.
textFirstPerson: I refer to unlawful deductions made from my wages.

summary: I'm writing regarding my employment situation.
textFirstPerson: I write in relation to my employment situation.

summary: I'm writing further to my dismissal because of performance.
textFirstPerson: I refer to my unfair dismissal on the purported ground of poor performance.

summary: I'm writing regarding the current redundancy process, which I believe to be unfair and discriminatory.
textFirstPerson: I refer to the current redundancy process.

summary: I'm writing further to my recent resignation.
textFirstPerson: I refer to my recent resignation.

summary: Resigned because of unlawful deductions of wages - constructive dismissal.
textFirstPerson: I resigned because of unlawful deductions of wages that are a fundamental breach of my contract of employment.

summary: I refer to my suspension which was unjustified.
textFirstPerson: I refer to my suspension from work on [date].

summary: Following my recent dismissal, I'm writing to express serious concerns.
textFirstPerson: I refer to my recent unfair dismissal.

summary: I resigned because of mistreatment due to whistleblowing.
textFirstPerson: I refer to my recent resignation due to mistreatment because of my whistleblowing. This amounts to automatically unfair constructive dismissal.

summary: I have felt bullied.
textFirstPerson: I was bullied by the following actions.[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].
textThirdPerson: This was part of a sustained campaign of humiliation, professional undermining and bullying.

summary: It's clear that my treatment was discriminatory.
textFirstPerson: My treatment was due to my [protected characteristic(s)]. That's clear because:[Explain why. Remember it’s not always obvious why the treatment is discriminatory, however bad it is. Always compare to how someone else of a different sex, race etc was/would have been treated (except for disability where you don't have to compare). Aim to explain the discriminatory reason(s) as clearly as possible.E.g. ‘There were three of us who lost office keys. I was the only female and the only one disciplined. The two male colleagues didn’t face any consequences.’NB: you don’t need this paragraph if the examples of bad treatment you provided in the previous paragraph are self-explanatory, e.g. racist or sexist jokes.]

summary: Your actions had a discriminatory motive as there is no rational explanation to such appalling treatment.
textFirstPerson: Your actions were motivated by my [insert protected characteristic] as there is no rational explanation to such appalling treatment.[Use this paragraph if you can't give clear reasons why the treatment was discriminatory.]

summary: I was subjected to unlawful discrimination.
textFirstPerson: I was subjected to unlawful [insert protected characteristic(s)] discrimination, in particular:[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].

summary: There was a lack of empathy so that I feel bullied. This is discrimination.
textFirstPerson: There was a lack of empathy for my situation to the extent that I felt bullied. This would amount to discrimination on the grounds of [insert protected characteristic].[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].

summary: There has been a lack of empathy so that I feel bullied. This is discrimination.
textFirstPerson: There has been a lack of empathy for my situation to the extent that I feel bullied. This would amount to discrimination on the grounds of [insert protected characteristic].[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].

summary: I've been subjected to unlawful discrimination
textFirstPerson: I’ve been subjected to unlawful [insert protected characteristic(s)] discrimination, in particular:[provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].

summary: Your seemingly neutral practice discriminated against me indirectly.
textFirstPerson: Your practice of [explain the practice] placed me at a disadvantage because of my [insert relevant protected characteristic]. This is unlawful indirect discrimination.[Add detail, explaining how the employer’s seemingly neutral policy or practice affected people of your protected characteristic.]

summary: Your seemingly neutral practice has discriminated against me indirectly.
textFirstPerson: Your practice of [explain the practice] has placed me at a disadvantage because of my [insert relevant protected characteristic]. This is unlawful indirect discrimination.[Add detail, explaining how the employer’s seemingly neutral policy or practice affects people of your protected characteristic. Bullet points might be a useful way to show that.]

summary: I complained about discrimination and I was victimised.
textFirstPerson: On [date] I complained that I'd been discriminated against [to who and how]. This was a protected act. After making my protected act, I was subjected to the following detriments: [provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible]. This amounts to unlawful victimisation.

summary: I complained about discrimination and have been victimised.
textFirstPerson: On [date] I complained that I'd been discriminated against [to who and how]. This was a protected act. After making my protected act, I've been subjected to the following detriments: [provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible]. This amounts to unlawful victimisation.

summary: I have a physical or mental condition.
textFirstPerson: [As you’re aware,] I have [condition name(s)], which is a disability. [My absence from work on [dates] was caused by my disability.]

summary: You didn't consider making reasonable adjustments for me.
textFirstPerson: You didn’t consider making reasonable adjustments for me, as required by the Equality Act 2010 [add detail if possible - what reasonable adjustments could’ve been helpful?].

summary: Ethical veganism has been accepted by the employment tribunals as a form of protected belief.
textFirstPerson: Ethical veganism is a protected philosophical belief under the Equality Act 2010.

summary: I've paid less for equal work because of my gender.
textFirstPerson: I've been paid less than a male colleague for equal work. [add details here]. An 'equality clause' is implied in every employment contract, which means that you have breached my contract by paying me less than this colleague.

summary: Disciplinary process/action against me is unfair.
textFirstPerson: The disciplinary process against me is unjustified and unfair, and any resulting disciplinary action would clearly be unfair. In particular: [add up to three bullet points with the strongest reasons that it is unfair. Examples: lack of evidence; that even if proven, the action wasn't misconduct; bias. Try to explain your reasons.]

summary: Resigned due to excessive workload.
textFirstPerson: My workload was so excessive and stressful it constituted a repudiatory breach of contract. Therefore, my resignation was unfair constructive dismissal. In particular, [provide up to three bullet points showing how your employer treated you so badly. If just one point, keep on this line. If more than one, bullet point format is good.]

summary: Haven't been provided with employment particulars in writing.
textFirstPerson: I haven't been provided with a written statement of my main employment terms, as required by the Employment Rights Act.
textThirdPerson: I requested an updated contract as the only contract in my possession was that dated [. ] when I joined the business. This was not issued at the time of request in February 2019, nor has it been issued subsequently, though I have been working in that position. This is a breach of the employer’s duty to provide the employee with a written statement of initial employment particulars or of any changes to their terms of employment.

summary: Danger from Coronavirus at work.
textFirstPerson: I was asked to attend a workplace that was unsafe due to Coronavirus, which is in breach of your health and safety duty. It was unsafe because [explain why it was unsafe, e.g. 'due to the number of people in the office it was impossible to maintain a safe distance'; 'there were no ventilation in the seminar room where I was required to teach'.]  I could've carried out my role remotely, but I wasn't allowed.

summary: Subjeced to detriment because of refusing to attend an unsafe workplace.
textFirstPerson: I've been mistreated because of my refusal to attend an unsafe workplace, which is against the Employment Rights Act. In particular, [provide up to 3 bullet points of strong, recent examples of the detriment/mistreatment - try to keep them within the last 2-3 months, if possible].

summary: You failed your health & safety duty - coronavirus unsafe workplace.
textFirstPerson: Your insistence that I attend an unsafe workplace is unlawful and constitutes a fundamental breach of contract. I'm considering resigning in response to that, which would amount to unfair constructive dismissal.
textThirdPerson: Second, you failed your duty in respect of health and safety. I’m being asked to attend a workplace that is unsafe due to coronavirus. I could work from home, but I’m not being allowed. I’m regularly being called into meetings in the office that are either unecessary or could be conducted remotely. I’ve been subjected to detrimental treatment in respect of my health and safety, which is a violation of s.44 and potentially of s.100 of the Employment Rights Act 1996.

summary: My pay's been cut because of refusing to attend an unsafe workplace.
textFirstPerson: I've been unlawfully subjected to a detriment because of my refusal to attend an unsafe workplace. In particular, I've had my income reduced unfairly. [Provide details of the pay cut].I don't have to accept any reduction in pay because I've taken protected action under the Employment Rights Act. I'm entitled to full pay under section 44. Therefore, you should reimburse the income I've lost so far and put me back on the payroll.If steps aren't taken to ensure that my workplace is safe [provide detail if possible], I intend to continue to exercise my rights.

summary: Making me attend unsafe workplace is unlawful - constructive dismissal.
textFirstPerson: Your insistence that I attend an unsafe workplace was unlawful and constituted a fundamental breach of contract. I resigned in response to that, which amounts to unfair constructive dismissal.

summary: My contract specifies [amount of payment].
textFirstPerson: My contract of employment provides that I'm paid £ [insert £ amount] by way of [insert ONE of the following: salary OR bonus OR commission OR car allowance OR (insert other specified benefit)].

summary: You reduced my salary without my agreement.
textFirstPerson: The following payments became due and weren't paid: [list sums and dates here].   I didn't agree to this deduction and therefore it's unlawful. Please rectify it.

summary: Intend to claim the difference between what was paid and owed to me.
textFirstPerson: If you don't rectify this unlawful deduction, I intend to present a claim for the difference between what you paid and what I was owed.
textThirdPerson: - payment of the difference between what you paid and what I was contractually entitled to.

summary: The unlawful deductions of my wages had a negative effect on me.
textFirstPerson: This unlawful deduction of my wages has [insert whichever of the following apply: -- negatively affected my confidence and mental health -- caused me stress-- caused me financial hardship].

summary: Unlawful deductions of wages are a breach of contract - entitled to resign and claim constructive dismissal.
textFirstPerson: This unlawful deduction fundamentally breaches my contract of employment and would entitle me to resign and claim constructive dismissal in an employment tribunal.

summary: Gross misconduct - investigation and dismissal unfair.
textFirstPerson: Dismissal for gross misconduct must follow a fair procedure and be fair in the circumstances. This includes investigating the matter properly and giving the employee a chance to respond. This wasn't done in my case. [Add detail, if possible.]

summary: My performance wasn't poor.
textFirstPerson: The implementation of the performance improvement plan was unfair and you failed to follow your own procedure.
textThirdPerson: i am caroline this is my third person para

summary: You didn't follow a reasonable procedure before dismissing for poor performance.
textFirstPerson: You didn't follow a reasonable procedure for performance management before dismissing me. That includes adequate warnings and an opportunity to improve. In particular, [add up to 3 bullet points providing details.] The dismissal was therefore unfair.

summary: If a meaningful consultation were to be carried out, I wouldn't be made redundant because ... .
textFirstPerson: If a meaningful consultation were carried out I would not be made redundant because [List here any issues you could raise in a genuine consultation that might alter the decision to dismiss you. Examples: 'I could identify another role [name of role] that I am also qualified to carry out'; 'I could tell you about an alternative way of funding my role.]

summary: This shows that the selection process was predetermined.
textFirstPerson: There is a suitable alternative vacancy [name the vacancy] that hasn’t been considered for me. It’s suitable because [explain why].

summary: Suitable alternative employment wasn't considered.
textFirstPerson: The outcome of the redundancy process was predetermined.

summary: The current redundancy selection criteria are unfair [and discriminatory] because ... .
textFirstPerson: The criteria used in the selection process are discriminatory because [provide up to 3 bullet point examples, starting with the strongest e.g.-- 'The selection criteria include sickness absence which discriminates against me as I am disabled and have more sickness absences than other, non-disabled, colleagues';-- 'The criteria target part-time workers which discriminates against women;'-- 'The criteria put people with childcare responsibilities at a disadvantage, which amounts to indirect discrimination on the grounds of sex and/or marriage or civil partnership'].

summary: I have a disability  - choosing me for potential redundancy is discriminatory.
textFirstPerson: I have [name condition(s)], which is a disability. My absence from work has been caused by my disability. You should be making reasonable adjustments to support me. [In particular, ... set out the adjustments if possible.] Not helping me return to work and choosing me for potential redundancy is unfavourable treatment amounting to disability discrimination.

summary: You're implementing the restructure in bad faith to remove me because ... .
textFirstPerson: There is no reduction in the amount of my work, so this isn't a genuine redundancy. You are acting in bad faith to remove me from the organisation because [Insert your reasons - for example:'I raised a grievance which was unfairly rejected and so you now wish to get rid of me'; 'I told you about unlawful activities going on in the company and you do not want to deal with them'; 'I am about to go on maternity leave and you wish to appoint someone permanently to carry out my duties'.]

summary: No actual reduction in work - redundancy based on anticipation of losses only.
textFirstPerson: This is not a genuine redundancy situation as there hasn't been an actual reduction in the amount of work that I do. Selecting me for potential redundancy is based on a speculative anticipation of losses only. Therefore, my redundancy would be unfair.
textThirdPerson: Anticipating [losses] doesn’t mean I’m redundant - there is still the same amount of work to be done, therefore I’m not being dismissed because of a reduction in the amount of the type of work I do. For this reason, this is not a genuine redundancy dismissal and and resulting dismissal will inevitably be unfair.

summary: Should be selected for the new role.
textFirstPerson: The newly created role [insert role title] contains many of my duties and I should have been appointed to that role or at the very least considered for it.

summary: You were implementing the restructure in bad faith to remove me because ... .
textFirstPerson: There was no reduction in the amount of work that I did, so it wasn't a genuine redundancy. You removed me from the organisation in bad faith because  [Insert your reasons - for example:I raised a grievance which was unfairly rejected and so you now wish to get rid of me; I told you about unlawful activities going on in the company and you do not want to deal with them; I am about to go on maternity leave and you wish to appoint someone permanently to carry out my duties.]

summary: Bad treatment led to constructive dismissal.
textFirstPerson: Your treatment of me amounted to a fundamental breach of the implied term of trust and confidence in our employment agreement. Accordingly, my resignation was unfair constructive dismissal, and would entitle me to claim compensation in an employment tribunal.

summary: My suspension was a kneejerk reaction.
textFirstPerson: My suspension was a 'kneejerk' reaction. You gave no reason as to why suspension was necessary. It was a breach of the implied term of trust and confidence between the employer and employee. I'm entitled to resign and claim constructive dismissal.

summary: I refer to my suspension, which was discriminatory and due to whistleblowing.
textFirstPerson: I was suspended because of my whistleblowing. In particular, [list up to 3 bullet points showing this, starting with the strongest.]

summary: Whistleblowing/health & safety - was mistreated.
textFirstPerson: I made the following protected disclosure(s):[insert dates and details of your complaints about unlawful activity].I've been subjected to the following detriments because of my whistleblowing:[insert details].

summary: Whistleblowing - was mistreated.
textFirstPerson: I made the following protected disclosure(s): [insert dates and details of your complaints about unlawful activity in the workplace]. This resulted in my dismissal on [date], which is automatically unfair due to whistleblowing.

summary: Lack of empathy - constructive dismissal.
textFirstPerson: Your lack of empathy amounts to a fundamental breach of the implied term of trust and confidence in our employment agreement. This would entitle me to resign and claim compensation for unfair constructive dismissal in an employment tribunal.

summary: My employment no longer tenable, but reserving position.
textFirstPerson: Your treatment of me amounts to fundamental breach of contract, so I could resign and claim constructive dismissal. However, I have not yet decided whether to resign.

summary: I'm considering bringing a claim (except for discrimination).
textFirstPerson: I am prepared to present an employment tribunal claim, which would result in substantial damages.
textThirdPerson: Our client is prepared to present an employment tribunal claim, which would result in substantial damages.

summary: I believe that subjecting me to unnecessary and unjustified performance management is unfair and demonstrates a lack of empathy - this entitles me to resign and claim unfair constructive dismissal.
textFirstPerson: Subjecting me to unnecessary and unjustified performance management demonstrates a lack of empathy. This is a fundamental breach of the implied term of trust and confidence in our employment agreement. It would entitle me to resign and claim compensation for unfair constructive dismissal.
